name: Windows Transliteration File
summary: Learn about .NLT files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: As part of its Globalization Services, Windows includes Extended Linguistic Services (ELS) that are implemented as a dynamic link library (DLL). When developers create internationalized Windows apps, they can reference Windows' ELS to perform certain functions, including automatically mapping UTF-16 characters used in one language to characters used in another language.

To map characters between languages, Windows uses NLT files. These files are often named after the languages they link. For example, the first NLT file listed in the C:/​~/​ELS/​Transliteration directory is named bengali-to-latin.nlt.

instructions: NLT files are Windows system files that are not meant to be opened. Windows APIs reference NLT files when Windows' Extended Linguistic Services transliterate a language.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
